column4: The repository might be no longer available or could not be contacted because of network problems. If available an older version of the failed index will be used. Otherwise the repository will be ignored. Check your network connection and the correct writing of the repository address in the preferences.
http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/dapper-backports/restricted/binary-i386/Packages.bz2: Sub-process bzip2 returned an error code (2)
Would they steal my wallet and stab me in a dark alley?
Ahh. Hoary, Breezy, Dapper, Edgy is next!
Sooo, I should really just wait for Edgy to come out, right?
I just want to keep my system working.
I'm happy to stick to security updates.
sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list, fix the file, then sudo apt-get update
you added extras, just remove them
